context_bundle.summary: Crossplane is an open-source Kubernetes add-on that transforms a cluster into a universal control plane for any cloud or service

onboarding.quick_start: helm install crossplane --namespace crossplane --create-namespace crossplane-stable/crossplane && kubectl apply -f composite-resource-definition.yaml
common_patterns: Provider installation: 'kubectl apply -f provider-aws.yaml' for AWS provider
Composition definition: 'apiVersion: apiextensions.crossplane.io/v1 kind: Composition' with resources
Claim template: 'apiVersion: apiextensions.crossplane.io/v1 kind: Composition' with claimTemplates
Managed resources: 'kubectl get managed -n crossplane-system' to verify created resources
known_errors: Provider not ready: 'kubectl get provider.pkg' and check 'READY' status and conditions
Composition failed: 'kubectl get composite -n crossplane-system' and check events for creation errors
Claim stuck: 'kubectl describe claim <claim-name>' and verify composition and resource template configuration
Permission denied: 'kubectl auth can-i create managedresources --as=system:serviceaccount:crossplane-system:crossplane'
Resource reconciliation: 'kubectl get managed -o wide' and check external resource status
